name: Fenice Palace Hotel

reviews.title: Dirty Smelly Hotel
reviews.text: This hotel should be avoided if at all possible. We only stayed in it, as we had to leave an even worse one, the Old Florence Inn, which is also a complete fraud. The Tourist office gave us the impression that this was the only hotel available as there was a massive conference in town.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first room we saw stank of cigaretter smoke and the bathroom was dirty with even the looking glass showing its age. The second room we settled for, had wallpaper peeling off everywhere and the holes in the ceiling were filled with tissue paper!!! The corridors stank and the elevators had broken down. The only good thing about the hotel was one friendly check in clerk and a decent breakfast.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Fantastic Concierge

reviews.text: What is the amazing about this terrible hotel is that it is in a fantastic location in a world famous place. What are the owners thinking they are doing letting a valuable asset like this going to rot? I would love to see the owners respond to this comment.
reviews.title: good location, but so so!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a way to experience Florence for the very first time.
reviews.title: Terrible....

reviews.text: We traveled SF to Paris, Paris to Rome, then transferred to the train
reviews.title: No way 4 star and smelt of drains

reviews.text: We stayed at the Fenice Palace at the beginning of the month. On the plus side the location couldn't be better if you want to be close to the Duomo, we also found the desk to be very helpful. Unfortunetly the room was hot with poor air conditioning and the bed was hard as a rock (not a good thing).
reviews.title: Great location, hot room, rock hard bed
Worst Hotel we stayed at in Italy
reviews.text: We were in Italy this summer for 2 weeks and basically started in Lake Como and ended in Amalfi. We stayed at 8 different hotels while there and all had a 4 star rating. Most of the hotels were okay, but the Fenice Palace was terrible. I was so glad that we only stayed there for one night. The rooms are smelly, dark, old, moldy. The beds are small and the comforters are disgusting. The showers aren't great either. The water would go all over the floor everytime we took a shower. The rest of the hotel is not much to get excited about either. Everything looks worn and in need of major repair/renovation. Definitely do not stay here if you are driving in Italy. We had the hardest time getting to it, because it is so close to the Duomo. We had to valet park which was not only pricey but inconvenient. The morning we left we ended up waiting 45 min for our car. I don't think I have ever stayed at a hotel this bad before. Maybe a motel, but not a hotel and definitely not one with a 4 star rating. If I ever go back to Florence, I would stay on the outskirts of the city. The city is small enough that it is easy to get to the tourist area. I can't believe anyone gave this hotel a good rating.

reviews.title: No palace here
reviews.text: The Fenice Palace Hotel is located only a few minutes walk from the famous Duomo and so is the ideal place from which to conduct expenditions into Florence. However, we entirely agree with other previous guests who were disappointed with the standard of the hotel. Our room was acceptable (clean and airconditioned) , but certaintly not 4 star standard. Although we liked the staff, we are particularly disgusted with the standard of the breakfast service. One morning, we hate to wait for a table to become available, and then could get no service. Everything in the buffet gives the impression of having been done on the cheap: bad cornflakes, watered down juice, stale rolls, poor coffee. All of this must be improved in order to avoid a complete boycott by international guests.

reviews.title: Convenient and Comfortable
reviews.text: The hotel is extremely convenient and within 100 yards of the Duomo and street market. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms, we had two, were large by European standards and despite a dated interior the rooms were comfortable and very functional. The bathrooms were all large, had hairdryers and electrical outlets that accepted 110V. The double rooms had two twin sized beds. The breakfast was excellent with great service.

reviews.title: Quaint
reviews.text: I was disappointed after reading the other reviews. I stumbled in to this hotel after the first hotel we planned to stay at was closed. So here I was I was traveling with two year old twins and a nanny on Christmas Eve and no place to stay! The staff was more than accommodating and helpful. I loved the old style hotel to begin with, I guess if you want modern this hotel isn't for you. I felt at home and relaxed there. The rooms that we stayed in were fine. I loved the fact that they had bathtubs!! A rarity in Italy. We moved to a larger apartment on the second day which provided a separate sleeping room for our nanny. The only complaint I had was that the apartment, being up on the top floor, would get a little warm at night. No problems with the elevators while we were there, I thought the braiding was a novel idea, I liked it. Breakfast and bar were fine. My children loved the staff and cried when we had to leave. Location of the hotel was great, walking distance to most of the attractions that we wanted to see, restaurants that were close and shopping markets all around us. LOVED IT.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The +:
reviews.title: New Year's Crackers!

likes.liked: — Huge bed, really hard, really nice to sleep on!
likes.disliked: — Shower was old, as paperwalls, and colors in the room

reviews.title: Quite one of the worst hotels in Florence
reviews.text: - Central location. Certainly the best spot to visit most of major city's attractions, close enough to train and bus station, really nice to walk around.

likes.liked: — Proximity to the centre of Firenze and main tourist attractions
likes.disliked: — Filthy dirty throughout & poor food- also traffic noise very prevalent

reviews.text: - Nice staff, nice breafast (standard criterias), quiet hotel...
reviews.title: Good value, great location

reviews.text: The -:
reviews.title: Great value and free breakfast

reviews.text: - A bit rusty around the edge, paper walls, paintings, faded colors in the rooms, our warm water in the shower was very weak... A FOUR Star Hotel should have higher standards.
reviews.title: Smelled like baby diapers

likes.liked: — The breakfasts were good. Meats, cheese, rolls and machine-made coffee
likes.disliked: — The smell was awful for the 4 days we were there, also dirty linens in the hall weren't removed

reviews.title: Good room, Great Location!
reviews.text: From some of the reviews I have read, I cannot believe I stayed at the same hotel as the writers! A friend and I stayed at the Fenice Palace for two nights early in May. This was not our first choice of hotel, but we would definitely book the Fenice Palace again and have recommended it to friends. Despite our early arrival that day we were able to check in promptly. The staff was friendly, knowledgeable and accommodating. Our room was clean and quite satisfactory. A double room, it contained two double beds, the only Italian hotel we stayed in with this feature! The bathroom was clean, large enough and had a bath as well as shower. We overlooked Via Martelli, so it was slightly noisy, but not a problem. It was fabulous to look left from our balcony and see the battistero!

reviews.title: Excellant situation
reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel over a dozen times. It is ideally suited for all the sights. The staff friendly and very helpful. I have recommened them to numerous friends who were equally satisfied.

reviews.title: How did this dump get four stars?
reviews.text: The rooms adequate if not huge, but then who stays in their room in the beautiful city of Florence ?!!

This hotel represented the low point of our entire trip. We stayed at four-star hotels all over Italy, and they were either good or very good. This place was absolutely horrible! The rickety elevator took us to our smelly hallway. The carpeting was filthy and disgusting, and our room was dark, musty, and depressing. The bed felt like a wooden plank, and the bathroom almost defies description. It was long and narrow, so that you almost had to walk sideways from the toilet to the sink and tub. The shower was ridiculous - located on the long wall over the tub instead of the end wall, and the water actually went right through the shower curtain onto the bathroom floor. Even the public computer in the lobby was gross, as the keyboard was dirty and greasy. We could not wait to get out of there and continue to be baffled by the four-star rating. Do not stay there!!
reviews.title: Great value for money
Rough Accomidations in a Fabulous Location!
reviews.text: We stayed 6 nights early Sept and were very pleased with our accomodation for the price we paid, the location couldn't be beaten. We took a taxi from the train station it only cost Eur 8. Staff at reception were friendly. Just a couple of mins walk to Duomo. Double glazed windows kept out any street noise. A supermarket is just a 5min walk away. Breakfast was very good overall, compared to other hotels on our trip. We had no problems and I would recommend this hotel since it has now been refurbished.

description: Currently closed for renovations. Modern Hotel in a 5-story, 18th-century building, originally a Florentine Palace.
